results.title: Each child is different
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Dramatised incidents are used in presenting a study of five fifth-grade children, whose personalities and backgrounds present typical problems. The film explains the importance of the elementary school teacher’s knowledge of the complex and different backgrounds of the children, as well as their individual abilities and needs, in order to adjust the teaching program to meet these needs.

results.title: E.T. the extra-terrestrial (special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg’s heartwarming masterpiece of love between a young boy and a visitor from another planet has quickly become one of the most popular films of all time. Filled with magic and imagination, it made audiences around the world laugh and cry. Follows the story of a lost alien who befriends a 10 year old boy named Elliott. While E.T. learns about life on Earth, Elliott learns that friendship knows no earthly bounds. Overflowing with memorable performances, a stirring musical score by John Williams, its scenes of wonderment invite everyone to share the thrill of its magic. Cast includes Dee Wallace, Peter Coyote, Drew Barrymore and Henry Thomas as Elliott. Spielberg corrected certain scenes on the 20th anniversary edition with visual (computer assisted) improvement.

results.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
results.creator_credit: Carlo Rambaldi, Melissa Mathison, Kathleen Kennedy, Steven Spielberg, Al Bailey, James D. Bissell, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: After a gentle alien becomes stranded on Earth, the being is discovered and befriended by a young boy named Elliott. Bringing the extraterrestrial into his suburban California house, Elliott introduces E.T., as the alien is dubbed, to his brother and his little sister, Gertie, and the children decide to keep its existence a secret. Soon, however, E.T. falls ill, resulting in government intervention and a dire situation for both Elliott and the alien.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

results.title: E.K. Okay
results.brief_description: This film follows three pairs of Scottish teenagers thrown together on a gruelling two-day cross-country race to raise money for “Sport Aid”. Stamina is not all that is put to the test in this frank, but often funny account of teenage relationships. The youngsters all come from the Key Youth Centre in East Kilbride, the sixth largest town in Scotland.

results.title: E E Cummings: the making of a poet
results.brief_description: Traces the poetic growth of E. E. Cummings, using his own voice, poetry paintings, drwaings and notebooks. Poems included are: ‘Thank You God For Most This Amazing’, ‘If There Are Any Heavens My Mother’, ‘In Just Spring’, ‘Life Is More True Than Reason Will Deceive’, ‘Paris’, “The April Sunset Completely Utters’, ‘Carry Your Heart With Me’ and others. The narration is adapted from ‘Six Nonlectures’ by E. E. Cummings recorded at Havard University.

results.title: Dysphasic school children
results.creator_credit: Louise Janas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Dysphasic children are those who have trouble expressing and understanding language, and are thus unable to take advantage of much classroom teaching. This program outlines the different teaching methods required to help with their speech difficulties.

results.title: Dynasties
results.creator_credit: Tim Clark, Stephen Ramsey and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Using rare archival footage, photographs and interviews, we are privy to family life and relationships of seven of Australia’s most powerful families. Nineteenth and twentieth century Australian history has been formed by some of the influence of these families - pastoralists, philanthropists, politicians and journalists - and some of their influence on society continues today. Families are: Murdoch, Downer, Wright, Myer, Durack, De Bortolis, and Macarthur. Two-disc set containing seven episodes from Series One of this fascinating ABC TV Documentary series. Narrated by William Zappa.
